title: Submodule Initialization fails for `safe-contracts` dependency
body:
<!--
Need help?
Refer to our contributing guidelines for additional information about making a good issue:
https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/.github/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md
-->

**Describe the bug**
Invoking `make submodules` results in the following error:
```bash
fatal: Unable to find refs/remotes/origin/v1.4.0 revision in submodule path 'packages/contracts-bedrock/lib/safe-contracts'
PYTHONPATH=./bedrock-devnet python3 ./bedrock-devnet/main.py --monorepo-dir=. --allocs
```

The [.gitmodules](https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/blob/007e1a2dc0c393edb3af215d5c460d50810a700e/.gitmodules) makes a reference to a `v1.4.0` branch for safe-contracts which doesn't actually exist in the repo. It appears that this being used to try to alias a [release](https://github.com/safe-global/safe-contracts/releases/tag/v1.4.0) which is failing. 


**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
Run `make submodules` from monorepo root

**System Specs:**
 - OS: Mac
 - Package Version (or commit hash):

**Additional context**
Add any other context about the problem here.
